headline.main: WOODWARD LOOKS TO BRITAIN TO WIN; Rear Admiral, Retiring April 1, Pins Faith on Fleet's Ability to Control the Seas FOR MORE DESTROYER AID Commandant Here Says U.S. Could Spare 50 Others -- Off on Month Leave Today

lead_paragraph: Confident of an ultimate British victory, Rear Admiral Clark Howell Woodward, retiring Commandant of the Third Naval District and of the Navy Yard in Brooklyn, believes that the United States could "very easily give another fifty destroyers" to Britain.
abstract: Rear Adm C H Woodward believes Brit will win
